position.marginalia_text: Nemini vnq[uam] satis fuit Constantia[e] in Optimis.

marginalia.translation: Constancy in the greatest men was never enough for anyone.

position.marginalia_text: Simplicis est, in paruis ha[e]rescere, ( Signa in mundo maiora.

marginalia.translation: The simple man clings to small things, greater signs are in the world.
Whoever can endure it, wins it.
There are many magnanimous men and very few patient ones.

position.marginalia_text: tristem; nunq[uam] timidum; nunq[uam] irresolutum; nunq[uam] ignavum, aut languidum; nunq[uam] sui, aut aliorum immemorem; nunq[uam] perturbatum vllo Casu. Non noui hominem, beneficioru[m]
magis memorem; aut iniuriarum magis immemore[m]. Nec scio alique[m], cuius rationes, et actiones ità dependent à Seipso. Ha[e]c ille sobrius generosus de Axiophilo ingenuè.

marginalia.translation: [never] sad, never timid, never irresolute, never lazy or languid, never forgetful of himself or of others, never disturbed by any happening. I have never known a man more mindful of favors, or more forgetful of injuries. Nor do I know of anyone whose reasons and actions depend so much on himself. The sensible noble, man naturally finds these things in Axiophilus.

position.marginalia_text: Hominum dicta, et facta errant: Artium, et Virtutum, non errant.

marginalia.translation: The words and deeds of men err; those of art and virtue do not.

position.marginalia_text: Manie Quintessentians, curious in other things: but One Entelechist, euer mindful of Himself.
